alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 12:47PM MDT until June 16 at 5:04AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Washington... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. Pend Oreille River below Albeni Falls affecting Pend Oreille and Bonner Counties. For the Palouse River...including Potlatch...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road. Flooding will occur throughout the low lying areas of the St Joe Valley. Flooding of Aqua Park and outbuildings along the river that are not behind the levee will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 32.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will go above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 33.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.2 feet on 05/11/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM PDT.
